content: the fab5flower square crochet road style sisters in stitch/ crochet road the fab5flower square �1 pattern notes us terminology used throughout yarn used yarn and colors must have cotton in the following colors cream pearl pastel pink and antique pink this lovely yarn is a sport weight # 2 mercerised cotton 50 g = 125 m 1 75 oz = 137 yards this pattern should work with any yarn weight of your choice hook 3 25 mm or whatever size you would normally use with the yarn you choose pattern notes for help with standing stitches see shelley @spincushions youtube where i originally learnt how to do this https //www youtube com/watch v=br37kfrrj24&index=9&list=pladrxfglnvp-0l1_xogqvt4rft-vbmyfg&t=0s for help making false stitches when not changing colour see here https //youtu be/9bjdjai643e begin rounds 8 9 & 10 in different places so as to keep your work as neat as possible i recommend that you weave in your yarn ends as you go check your stitch count after each round this pattern is suitable for adventurous beginners to intermediate crocheters if you really want to make it you can do it invisible join - cut yarn with about a 10cm 4in tail pull tail firmly through the loop on your hook thread yarn tail onto a tapestry needle place needle from front to back through both front and back loops of indicated stitch usually 2nd st of the round now insert needle into the back loop and back bump or third loop of the last st of the round and pull through gently this makes the join invisible and finishes your round off neatly weave the end in and trim yarn ends see tatsiana s @liilabjorncrochet photo tutorial if you need help https // www lillabjorncrochet com/2015/01/how-do-you-join-and-weave-ends-in html special stitches 2trcl yarn over twice and insert your hook into stitch/space yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops twice there will be 2 loops on your hook yarn over twice and insert your hook into the same stitch/space yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops twice 3 loops on your hook yarn over and pull through all 3 loops on your hook 2htrcl yarn over twice and insert your hook into stitch/space yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops - there will be 3 loops on your hook yarn over twice and insert your hook into the same stitch/space yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops yarn over and pull through all 5 loops on your hook 2dccl yarn over and insert your hook into stitch/space yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops - there will be 2 loops on your hook yarn over and insert your hook into the same stitch/space yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops yarn over and pull through
